Job Title: SC User Researcher - £600 Inside ir35 - 6 months contract
Job Description: We are currently seeking a highly skilled User Researcher with SC clearance and GDS (Government Digital Service) experience for a 6-month contract assignment (Inside IR35) with one of our esteemed public sector client. As a User Researcher, you will have the opportunity to contribute to critical projects while providing valuable insights to enhance user experiences within the public sector. Responsibilities: Conduct user research activities, including interviews, surveys, and usability testing, following GDS guidelines and best practices. Analyse research data to extract meaningful findings and recommendations, aligning with GDS standards. Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure user-centred design practices, in line with GDS principles. Develop research plans, protocols, and reports that meet GDS requirements and documentation standards. Stay up to date with the latest user research methodologies and tools endorsed by GDS. Requirements: Proven experience as a User Researcher, specifically within GDS projects, in a fast-paced environment. Active SC clearance (Security Check). In-depth knowledge of GDS guidelines, standards, and best practices for user research. Proficiency in user research techniques (interviews, surveys, usability testing) following GDS principles. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and collaboration abilities. Bachelor's or master's degree in human-computer interaction, psychology, or related field preferred. This 6-month contract position is outside IR35, offering competitive compensation for your valuable contributions. To apply, please submit your CV. Note: Only candidates with active SC clearance and GDS experience will be considered for this contract role within the public sector.

Contract Business Change Manager Required Hybrid - Edinburgh 2-3 Days per week 6 Months + Extensions Outside IR35 £550pd Opus is partnered with an energy consultancy looking to hire a Contract Business Change Manager on an initial 6 month contract with a view to extend. The role will be working from their office in Edinburgh 2-3 days per week. Required: Apply a structured methodology and lead change management activities focused on the successful separation of two businesses as well as any future corporate integrations. Produce documentation, training and communications regarding business/process changes and employee actions required. For example – new time writing processes associated with our new HR systems. Build out businesses own change methodology, and contribute to the growth of our project and change capabilities across the company Implement a change management methodology, with supporting processes and tools, to support adoption of the changes required by the separation project and any integration projects Closely support our Communications Team to deliver timely, consistent and impactful comms on change Assess the change impact - Conduct impact analyses, assess change readiness, and identify key stakeholders Work closely with our major IT vendor for separation, forming a strong working relationship with their change manager – and ensuring we have all the relevant materials, training and hypercare ready for our major IT implementations Support training efforts – Where required, provide input, document requirements, and support the design and delivery of training programmes Monitor and report on change impact (e.g. adoption rates, employee engagement in impacted groups) Support change activity via existing channels (e.g. line manager forums) and create new channels as necessary (e.g. change champion network) If you are interested in the position please send an updated copy of your CV and what rate you require and I will be in touch to discuss the role in more detail.
